events.message: The policyholder reported a collision involving their car and a streetlight at the intersection, requesting to initiate an insurance claim.
The claim was reviewed and assigned to the Auto Accident category based on the description of the vehicle accident provided.
An experienced claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the customer's auto accident claim for efficient processing.
The customer was informed that their car collision claim has been officially acknowledged, and the investigation will begin shortly.
The claims agent requested police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates to proceed with the accident claim.
The policyholder uploaded all requested documents including the official police collision report and repair shop invoice.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacted witnesses to verify claim details related to the vehicle accident.
The investigation into the auto accident claim was completed after confirming fault and assessing the extent of vehicle damages.
Based on the investigation findings, a settlement offer covering damages to the car and collision repairs was formally proposed to the claimant.
The customer responded with approval of the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the timely handling of their vehicle claim.
The claim was officially approved by management following receipt of customer acceptance of the proposed auto accident settlement terms.
Insurance payment was processed and issued to the claimantâ€™s bank account to cover the car repairs as per the approved settlement.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following successful settlement payment and confirmation from the customer about repair completion.
All claim files and documentation related to the vehicle collision case were archived as per standard record retention policies.
